user_request: see creations saved in the google photos
screen_desc: The screenshot displays the "Settings" page of a mobile device with options related to backup, sync, and privacy settings. The user is backing up data to a Google account. There are sections for freeing up device storage by removing backed-up photos and videos, managing notification preferences, and adjusting Google Assistant card settings. Sharing options are also available, including removing videos from motion photos and disabling geo-location data in shared media. Additionally, the screen shows options to sync with Google Drive and manage location settings.
history_actions: click on the Photos app located at the upper left.
click on the "Confirm" button located at the bottom of screen.
click on the menu icon (often represented by three horizontal lines, also known as the "hamburger" icon) located at the top left.
click on the "Settings" located at the middle left.

think.Thought: The user has requested to see creations saved in Google Photos. The current screen displays the device settings, specifically related to backup and sync with Google Photos. Since the user has already accessed the Photos app and is now in the Settings section, I will need to navigate back to the Photos app to access the saved creations. The next step is to exit the settings and go back to the main Photos view.
Future Action Plan: Navigate back to the main Photos screen by pressing the back button or using an appropriate gesture to exit settings.
